17.text: The  Sweet  Nell  Prospect  is located at 30°50'55"S, 122°53'09"E (more or

18.text: less in the centre of M25/152 – Figure 1).

19.text: Available  records  show  that  between  1922  to  1927  from  a  weakly

20.text: deformed metabasalt host a total of 407.3t of gold ore at an average grade

21.text: of 74.8 g/t Au was mined,  processed and 30.48 kg gold was won. As per

22.text: WAGS the the gold containing quartz veins were narrow, ranged in width

23.text: from  20  –  50  cm,  and  had  strike    more  or  less  parallel  to  the  enclosing

24.text: greenstones.  The  mining  operation  was  confined  to  north-south  trending

27.text: The mine dumps contain quartz-felspar porphry and metabasalt, suggesting

28.text: that  the  veins  may  be  localised  near  the  contact  between  quartz-felspar

29.text: porphry and metabasalt. Although wallrock alteration ( Figure 5) from the

30.text: area has been reported, but in the mine dumps no alteration material was

text:
The  Sweet  Nell  Prospect  is located at 30°50'55"S, 122°53'09"E (more or 
 less in the centre of M25/152 – Figure 1).   
 Available  records  show  that  between  1922  to  1927  from  a  weakly 
 deformed metabasalt host a total of 407.3t of gold ore at an average grade 
 of 74.8 g/t Au was mined,  processed and 30.48 kg gold was won. As per 
 WAGS the the gold containing quartz veins were narrow, ranged in width 
 from  20  –  50  cm,  and  had  strike    more  or  less  parallel  to  the  enclosing 
 greenstones.  The  mining  operation  was  confined  to  north-south  trending 
 shallow workings over about 150 m. 
 The mine dumps contain quartz-felspar porphry and metabasalt, suggesting 
 that  the  veins  may  be  localised  near  the  contact  between  quartz-felspar 
 porphry and metabasalt. Although wallrock alteration ( Figure 5) from the 
 area has been reported, but in the mine dumps no alteration material was 
 5.2.  Prospecting – 31/01/1984 to 5/06/1984

25.text: economical  gold  resource  within  its  Morelands  Find  prospect.  Added  to  this

26.text: positive  exploration  probability  the  present high gold price also demand that

27.text: the Company should continue its exploration in the area. Accordingly, further

28.text: expenditure for exploration for the tenement  is recommended.
